page.title: 06CUBS SCOUTS AND BROWNIES
page.content: There has been a{Scout Group}in {Aston Ingham}for fifteen years, made up of a Cub Pack, Scout Troop, and a Venture Scout Unit- the last taking the name{Abbey de Cormeilles Venture {Unit}from the old Abbey in Normandy to whom the living at Aston Ingham was given by William the Conqueror. The Group draws its members from many of the surrounding villages, being the only rural group in a very large area. The Group has built its own Scout Hut, which also serves as a District Training Hut for the Ross-on Wye area and as a camp-site for visiting troops.It is also used by a {Brownie Pack.}The site was once Glebe Land and is rented from the Church Commissioners. The Scout Group plays a vital part in bringing the children of the area together now with schools closed.
